1.verse_text: This is the prophetic message that the Lord gave to Zephaniah son of Cushi, son of Gedaliah, son of Amariah, son of Hezekiah. Zephaniah delivered this message during the reign of King Josiah son of Amon of Judah:
“I will destroy everything from the face of the earth,” says the Lord .

“I will destroy people and animals; I will destroy the birds in the sky and the fish in the sea. and their houses ruined! They will not live in the houses they have built, nor will they drink the wine from the vineyards they have planted. it is approaching very rapidly! There will be a bitter sound on the Lord ’s day of judgment; a day of distress and hardship, a day of devastation and ruin, a day of darkness and gloom, a day of clouds and dark skies, for they have sinned against the Lord . Their blood will be poured out like dirt; in the day of the Lord ’s angry judgment. (The idolatrous images of these creatures will be destroyed along with evil people.) I will remove humanity from the face of the earth,” says the Lord . and all who live in Jerusalem. I will remove from this place every trace of Baal worship, as well as the very memory of the pagan priests. those who swear allegiance to the Lord while taking oaths in the name of their ‘king,’ and do not want the Lord ’s help or guidance.” for the Lord ’s day of judgment is almost here. The Lord has prepared a sacrificial meal; he has ritually purified his guests. I will punish the princes and the king’s sons, and all who wear foreign styles of clothing. who fill the house of their master with wealth taken by violence and deceit. “a loud cry will go up from the Fish Gate, wailing from the city’s newer district, and a loud crash from the hills. for all the merchants will disappear and those who count money will be removed. I will punish the people who are entrenched in their sin, those who think to themselves, ‘The Lord neither rewards nor punishes.’ at that time warriors will cry out in battle. Judgment will fall on the fortified cities and the high corner towers. and they will stumble like blind men, their flesh will be scattered like manure. The whole earth will be consumed by his fiery wrath. Indeed, he will bring terrifying destruction on all who live on the earth.”
I will remove those who worship the stars in the sky from their rooftops,
and those who turn their backs on the Lord
Be silent before the Lord God ,
“On the day of the Lord ’s sacrificial meal,
On that day I will punish all who leap over the threshold,
On that day,” says the Lord ,
Wail, you who live in the market district,
At that time I will search through Jerusalem with lamps.
The Lord ’s great day of judgment is almost here;
That day will be a day of God’s anger,
a day of trumpet blasts and battle cries.
I will bring distress on the people
Neither their silver nor their gold will be able to deliver them

2.verse_text: Bunch yourselves together like straw, you undesirable nation,

before God’s decree becomes reality and the day of opportunity disappears like windblown chaff, before the Lord ’s raging anger overtakes you – Strive to do what is right! Strive to be humble! Maybe you will be protected on the day of the Lord ’s angry judgment. and Ashkelon will become a heap of ruins. Invaders will drive away the people of Ashdod by noon, and Ekron will be overthrown. The Lord has decreed your downfall, Canaan, land of the Philistines: “I will destroy everyone who lives there!” By the sea they will graze, for the Lord their God will intervene for them and restore their prosperity. They taunted my people and verbally harassed those living in Judah. They will be overrun by weeds, filled with salt pits, Those of my people who are left will plunder their belongings; those who are left in Judah will take possession of their land.” for they taunted and verbally harassed the people of the Lord who commands armies. for he will weaken all the gods of the earth. All the distant nations will worship the Lord in their own lands. it will be as barren as the desert. as well as every kind of wild animal. Owls will sleep in the tops of its support pillars; they will hoot through the windows. Rubble will cover the thresholds; even the cedar work will be exposed to the elements. the city that was so secure. She thought to herself, “I am unique! No one can compare to me!” Everyone who passes by her taunts her and shakes his fist. before the day of the Lord ’s angry judgment overtakes you! and as pens for their flocks. in the houses of Ashkelon they will lie down in the evening, and the Ammonites’ insults. “be certain that Moab will become like Sodom and the Ammonites like Gomorrah. and permanently desolate. and destroy Assyria. He will make Nineveh a heap of ruins; What a heap of ruins she has become, a place where wild animals live!
Seek the Lord ’s favor, all you humble people of the land who have obeyed his commands!
Those who live by the sea, the people who came from Crete, are as good as dead.
The seacoast will be used as pasture lands by the shepherds
Those who are left from the kingdom of Judah will take possession of it.
Therefore, as surely as I live,” says the Lord who commands armies, the God of Israel,
This is how they will be repaid for their arrogance,
“You Ethiopians will also die by my sword!”
The Lord will attack the north
Flocks and herds will lie down in the middle of it,
This is how the once-proud city will end up –

3.verse_text: The filthy, stained city is as good as dead; the city filled with oppressors is finished! she refuses correction. she does not seek the advice of her God. her rulers are as hungry as wolves in the desert, who completely devour their prey by morning. Her priests defile what is holy; they break God’s laws. he commits no unjust acts. Every morning he reveals his justice. At dawn he appears without fail. their walled cities are in ruins. Their cities are desolate; no one lives there. If she had done so, her home would not be destroyed by all the punishments I have threatened. in everything they did. “for the day when I attack and take plunder. I have decided to gather nations together For the whole earth will be consumed the nations to give me acceptable praise. All of them will invoke the Lord ’s name when they pray, and will worship him in unison. those who pray to me will bring me tribute. for then I will remove from your midst those who proudly boast, and they will find safety in the Lord ’s presence. Indeed, they will graze peacefully like sheep and lie down; Your hands must not be paralyzed from panic! He takes great delight in you; he renews you by his love; he shouts for joy over you.” they became tribute and were a source of shame to you. I will rescue the lame sheep and make the whole earth admire and respect them. at the time I gather you together. Be sure of this! I will make all the nations of the earth respect and admire you when you see me restore you,” says the Lord .

She is disobedient; She does not trust the Lord ; they are deceitful men. Yet the unjust know no shame. I turned their streets into ruins; no one passes through them. Now you will accept correction!’ But they eagerly sinned and assemble kingdoms, so I can pour out my fury on them – all my raging anger. by my fiery anger. and you will never again be arrogant on my holy hill. They will not lie, and a deceitful tongue will not be found in their mouth. no one will terrify them.” Shout out, Israel! Be happy and boast with all your heart, Daughter Jerusalem! he has turned back your enemy. Israel’s king, the Lord , is in your midst! You no longer need to fear disaster. “Don’t be afraid, Zion! he is a warrior who can deliver. I took them away from you; and gather together the scattered sheep. I will take away their humiliation
Her princes are as fierce as roaring lions;
Her prophets are proud;
The just Lord resides within her;
